t: Israel*pn is a luxuriant vine that*ld yields its fruit. The*ln more his fruit increased, the*ld more altars he built; as*ln his country improved, he*ld improved his pillars.
Their*ln heart is false; now*ld they must bear their guilt. The*ln Lord*s will break down their altars and*ld destroy their pillars.
For*pn now they will say: “We*ld have no king, for*ln we do not fear the Lord;*s and*ld a king— what could he do for us?”
They*ln utter mere words; with*ld empty oaths they make covenants; so*ln judgment springs up like poisonous weeds in*ld the furrows of the field.

The*ln inhabitants of Samaria tremble for*ld the calf of Beth-aven. Its*ln people mourn for it, and so do its idolatrous priests— those*ld who rejoiced over it and over its glory— for*ld it has departed from them.
The*ln thing itself shall be carried to Assyria as*ld tribute to the great king. Ephraim*ln shall be put to shame, and*ld Israel shall be ashamed of his idol.
Samaria’s*pn king shall perish like*ld a twig on the face of the waters.

The*ln high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall*ld be destroyed. Thorn*ln and thistle shall grow up on*ld their altars, and*ln they shall say to the mountains, “Cover us,” and*ld to the hills, “Fall on us.”
From*pn the days of Gibeah, you have sinned, O Israel; there*ld they have continued. Shall*ld not the war against the unjust overtake them in Gibeah?
When*ln I please, I will discipline them, and*ld nations shall be gathered against them when*ld they are bound up for their double iniquity.
Ephraim*pn was a trained calf that*ld loved to thresh, and*ld I spared her fair neck; but*ln I will put Ephraim to the yoke; Judah*ld must plow; Jacob*ld must harrow for himself.
Sow*ln for yourselves righteousness; reap*ld steadfast love; break*ld up your fallow ground, for*ln it is the time to seek the Lord,*s that*ld he may come and rain righteousness upon you.
You*pn have plowed iniquity; you*ld have reaped injustice; you*ld have eaten the fruit of lies. Because*ln you have trusted in your own way and*ld in the multitude of your warriors,

therefore*ln the tumult of war shall arise among your people, and*ld all your fortresses shall be destroyed, as*ln Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel on the day of battle; mothers*ld were dashed in pieces with their children.
Thus*ln it shall be done to you, O Bethel, because*ld of your great evil. At*ln dawn the king of Israel shall*ld be utterly cut off.
